register.name: PE1
register.description: Pin Enable 1 Register\n LLWU_PE1 contains the field to enable and select the edge detect type for the external wakeup input pins LLWU_P3-LLWU_P0

field.name: WUPE0
field.description: Wakeup Pin Enable For LLWU_P0\n Enables and configures the edge detection for the wakeup pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: External input pin disabled as wakeup input

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: External input pin enabled with rising edge detection

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: External input pin enabled with falling edge detection

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: External input pin enabled with any change detection

register.name: ME
register.description: Module Enable Register\n LLWU_ME contains the bits to enable the internal module flag as a wakeup input source for inputs MWUF7-MWUF0

field.name: WUME
field.description: Wakeup Module Enable For Modules 7-0\n Enables an internal module as a wakeup source input

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Internal module flag not used as wakeup source

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Internal module flag used as wakeup source

register.name: F1
register.description: Flag 1 Register\n LLWU_F1 contains the wakeup flags indicating which wakeup source caused the MCU to exit VLLS mode. For VLLS, this is the source causing the MCU reset flow. The external wakeup flags are read-only and clearing a flag is accomplished by a write of a 1 to the corresponding WUFx bit. The wakeup flag (WUFn), if set, will remain set if the associated WUPEn bit is cleared

field.name: WUF0
field.description: Wakeup Flag For LLWU 7-0\n Indicates that an enabled external wakeup pin was a source of exiting a low-leakage power mode. To clear the flag, write a 1 to WUFn

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: LLWU_Pn input was not a wakeup source

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: LLWU_Pn input was a wakeup source

register.name: F2
register.description: Flag 2 Register\n LLWU_F2 contains the wakeup flags indicating which wakeup source caused the MCU to exit VLLS mode. For VLLS, this is the source causing the MCU reset flow. The external wakeup flags are read-only and clearing a flag is accomplished by a write of a 1 to the corresponding WUFx bit. The wakeup flag (WUFn), if set, will remain set if the associated WUPEn bit is cleared

field.name: WUFn
field.description: Wakeup Flag For LLWU 15-8\n Indicates that an enabled external wakeup pin was a source of exiting a low-leakage power mode. To clear the flag, write a 1 to WUFn

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: LLWU_Pn input was not a wakeup source

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: LLWU_Pn input was a wakeup source

register.name: F3
register.description: Flag 3 Register\n LLWU_F3 contains the wakeup flags indicating which internal wakeup source caused the MCU to exit VLLS mode. For VLLS, this is the source causing the MCU reset flow. For internal peripherals that are capable of running in a low-leakage power mode, such as a real time clock module or CMP module, the flag from the associated peripheral is accessible as the MWUFx bit. The flag will need to be cleared in the peripheral instead of writing a 1 to the MWUFx bit

field.name: MWUFn
field.description: Wakeup flag For module N\n Indicates that an enabled internal peripheral was a source of exiting a low-leakage power mode. To clear the flag, follow the internal peripheral flag clearing mechanism

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Module N input was not a wakeup source

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Module N input was a wakeup source

register.name: FILT%s
register.description: Pin Filter %s register\n Control and status register that is used to enable/disable the digital filter features for an external pin

field.name: FILTSEL
field.description: Filter Pin Select\n Selects 1 out of the 16 wakeup pins to be muxed into the filter

field.name: FILTE
field.description: Digital Filter on External Pin\n Controls the digital filter options for the external pin detect

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Filter disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Filter positive edge detect enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Filter negative edge detect enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Filter any edge detect enabled

field.name: FILTF
field.description: Filter Detect Flag\n Indicates that the filtered external wakeup pin, selected by FILTSEL, was a source of exiting a low-leakage power mode. To clear the flag write a one to FILTF

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Pin Filter was not a wakeup source

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Pin Filter was a wakeup source
